intro: Iranecio massagetovii, commonly known as the Massagetovii iranecio, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are typically finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of its family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
